HiddenText.Name: How do I certify or accredit to become a professional genealogist?
HiddenText.OpenningText: How do I certify or accredit to become a professional genealogist?
HiddenText.BodyCopy:
Both the Board for Certification of Genealogists (BCG) and the International Commission for the Accreditation of Professional Genealogists (ICAPGen) have set standards for genealogical research and offer comprehensive examinations.  ICAPGen was formed to take on this certification role when the Church's Family History Department discontinued its own certification program some years ago.

The professional genealogical examinations given by both organizations validate applicants' knowledge of particular geographic localities and records and require them to demonstrate research proficiency.  The examinations are the genealogical equivalent of professional board certification in other disciplines. For more information, see these web sites: Board for Certification of Genealogists and The International Commission for the Accreditation of Professional Genealogists.
